Get started with dymium

Source: vignettes/get-started.Rmd
get-started.Rmd

Pre-requisitons

It is recommended that you use RStudio as your R IDE which can be downloaded for free from this link.

Installation

This tutorial is a quick start guide to build your first microsimulation model pipeline with dymium.

We begin by install the dymium package using either the devtools package or the remotes package.

# the lines below install the `remotes` package if it is not already installed.
if (!require("remotes")) {
  install.packages("remotes")  
}

# this install the `dymium` package from its github repo.
remotes::install_github("dymium-org/dymium")

By install the dymium package it will automatically install other dymium packages such as dymiumCore and dymiumApp as part of its dependencies. Basically, the dymium package act as a master package that when it is loaded it loads all other dymium packages, like the tidyverse package.

First model

Make sure you have completed the installation steps in the previous section.

To create your first dymium model you must first prepare your microdata which is the data of your agents.dymiumCore provides a toy dataset which contains linkable records of individuals and households with some basic attributes and relationship variables. But first you must load the package into your active R environment.

library(dymium)
#> + dymiumCore 0.0.10      Date: 2019-11-29
#>                                   R: 3.6.1
#>                                  OS: Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS
#>                                 GUI: X11
#>                                
#>
